1.	
Introduction
NOTE:	
This service bulletin was originally circulated as 

	
Marine liferafts — Spare parts : 
	
Consolidation of multiple branded part numbers

under the reference numbers which follow, which are now rescinded:
01/21 (RFD)
04/21 (SSS)
07/21 (Survitec)
02/21 (RFDB Inc)
05/21 (EV)
08/21 (DBC)
03/21 (SSPI)
06/21 (DSB)
09/21 (RFD Toyo)
10/21 (Zodiac)
Within the range of Survitec liferaft components and spares items, several common 
parts have been identified and rationalised. These are:
•	 Anti-seasickness tablets
•	 First aid kits
•	 Lights and batteries
This service bulletin tells service stations about new part numbers and how to 
order them.
2.	
Equipment affected
All Marine liferafts equipped with the parts given in Paragraphs 4.A thru 4.C.
3.	
Embodiment date
You must do this service bulletin at each scheduled liferaft service.
An expected timetable for the introduction of each new part number is given at 
6. Tasks.

Necessary parts

number that you need to order. 
You do not need to update your spares management system if you updated it in 
accordance with Version 2 of Service Bulletin 01/21 thru 10/21. 
No changes have been made to the tablets or their containers.

6.	
Tasks
A.	
Obey the correct service manual to service, test and pack the liferaft.
B.	
You can use existing stock of each current part number. It does not need to be 
removed from liferafts unless it is unserviceable (for instance, it is damaged or 
its date of expiry is before next scheduled liferaft service).
C.	
If you need to replace anti-seasickness tablets, you must order the new part 
number (refer to 4.A.)
D.	
If you need to replace a first aid kit, you must order the new part number 
(refer to 4.B.)
E.	
If you need to replace a light or battery, you must order the new part number 
(refer to 4.C.)
7.	
Recording
A.	
For each liferaft to which this service bulletin has been applied, complete the 
appropriate record card(s).
(1)	
Record details of the service onto the service record card. In the 
appropriate field, write “SB 12/24 Ver.1 APPLIED”.
8.	
Reporting
A.	
None required.

Marine Mk IV Liferafts — Hull :
Introduction of design changes
Version 1:
Dec/25

1.	
Introduction
As part of Survitec's ongoing commitment to continuous improvement and innovation, 
the design of the marine Mk IV liferaft has been updated to improve efficiency and 
reduce environmental impact (Refer to Figure 1).
This design will have reduced weight and packing bulk due to lower bulk materials 
and reduced adhesive. The operational packing procedure remains the same with the 
exception of the light attachment point. 
Figure 1
Mk IV 25 DL with new design features
Page 3 of 17
DUNMURRY - BELFAST - NORTHERN IRELAND 
SERVICE BULLETIN
23/24
Marine Mk IV Liferafts — Hull :
Introduction of design changes
Version 1:
Dec/25

Figure 2
New seam construction
The design changes that follow will be introduced:
Welded hull
•	
Construction of the hull now uses welded seams and attachments, replacing 
most glued joints (Refer to Figure 2).
Page 4 of 17
DUNMURRY - BELFAST - NORTHERN IRELAND 
SERVICE BULLETIN
23/24
Marine Mk IV Liferafts — Hull :
Introduction of design changes
Version 1:
Dec/25

Updated water pocket attachment
•	
Water pockets are now rigged to the liferaft floor using bowline knots 
(Refer to Figure 4). This allows water pockets to be replaced, if necessary.
Updated webbing and fabric materials
•	
Both webbing and fabric materials have been updated to support improved 
performance (Refer to Figure 3).
Figure 3
Updated webbing and fabric materials
Figure 4
Updated water pocket attachment
Page 5 of 17

SERVICE BULLETIN

Introduction of design changes
Version 1:

Updated attachment point for light activation line
•	
The attachment point for the light activation line has been moved from the 
loop patch to the adjacent liferaft lifelines (Refer to Figure 5).
Figure 5
Updated light attachment point
Page 6 of 17
DUNMURRY - BELFAST - NORTHERN IRELAND 
SERVICE BULLETIN
23/24
Marine Mk IV Liferafts — Hull :
Introduction of design changes
Version 1:
Dec/25

Updated attachment to floor insulation
•	
The floor insulation is now attached to the lifelines instead of the retaining 
elastic that was attached to the underside of the floor (Refer to Figure 6). 
Figure 6
Updated attachment to floor insulation
Page 7 of 17
DUNMURRY - BELFAST - NORTHERN IRELAND 
SERVICE BULLETIN
23/24
Marine Mk IV Liferafts — Hull :
Introduction of design changes
Version 1:
Dec/25

Improved canopy doorway
•	
The canopy doorway has been redesigned to improve watertightness and 
resistance to impact (Refer to Figure 7).
Figure 7
Improved canopy doorway - Open and closed
Page 8 of 17
DUNMURRY - BELFAST - NORTHERN IRELAND 
SERVICE BULLETIN
23/24
Marine Mk IV Liferafts — Hull :
Introduction of design changes
Version 1:
Dec/25

Use of water-based inks
•	
White water-based inks are now used for prints and stencils 
(Refer to Figure 8).
Figure 8
New white water-based inks

6.	
Tasks
A.	
Do the steps that follow to attach the light activation line.
NOTE:	
This procedure is compatible with all Mk4 liferafts already in 
service.
(1)	
Cut the correct length of activation line (50 Ib cord) (Refer to Table 1).
(2)	
Loop the activation line around two adjacent lifelines.
(3)	
Use a bowline knot to tie the activation line (Refer to Figure 9).
(4)	
Wind self-adhesive tape around the flying ends to hold in position.
B.	
Do the steps that follow to replace or repair the water pockets, if necessary:
(1)	
Tie the water pocket in position with a bowline knot at each loop.

1.	
Introduction 
NOTE:	
This service bulletin was originally circulated as

	
Marine Mk IV liferafts — Servicing : Servicing optimisation

under the reference numbers which follow, which are now rescinded:
27/21	 (RFD)
29/21	 (RFDB Inc)
30/21	 (SSPI)
31/21	 (SSS)
32/21	 (EV)
33/21	 (DSB)
As part of Survitec's commitment to continuous improvement, we have completed 
a review of liferaft service activities. This review has allowed us to make several 
improvements to the process which will reduce:
•	the time required to pack a liferaft (with reduced labour costs)
•	the waste sent to landfill during each service (with cost and environmental benefits)
This service bulletin tells service stations about new part numbers and how to order 
them. It also contains information about new techniques for preparing items during 
packing.
For other servicing optimisation tasks, refer to the service bulletins that follow:
•	44/21	 Marine liferafts — Servicing : Servicing optimisation (painter line sachet)
•	45/21	 Marine liferafts — Servicing : Servicing optimisation (radar reflector)
34/21	 (Survitec)

37/21	 (Zodiac)

Marine Mk IV liferafts — Servicing
Servicing optimisation (gasket seal, pyro/bellows valises, canopy zips)
Version 3:
Oct/24

A.	
Gasket seal
The gasket seal must be replaced at each service. 
Survitec has found that the current gasket seal might leave an adhesive residue 
on the container which must be removed before a new gasket seal can be 
installed. 
This is a time-consuming process.
The gasket seal has been revised; it now has an alternative adhesive which 
leaves no residue. Its part number has not changed.
Part number ;

Description

per liferaft

7001008
seal strip, self-adhesive, 
grey (10 × 19 mm), 
one metre

Page 6 of 20

SERVICE BULLETIN
43/21
Marine Mk IV liferafts — Servicing
Servicing optimisation (gasket seal, pyro/bellows valises, canopy zips)
Oct/24
Version 3:

B.	
Pyrotechnics valises
Currently each pyrotechnic (handheld flares, parachute flares, lifesmoke) is 
individually wrapped with pillowflex/bubblewrap. This pillowflex/bubblewrap 
must be removed and replaced at each service to allow inspection. 
This is a time-consuming process.
A series of new pyrotechnics valises has been introduced which will protect 
each item but which can be easily opened and, if serviceable, re-used at each 
liferaft service.
If a pyrotechnic is too large for a new pyrotechnic valise then you must use 
pillowflex/bubblewrap as per specified in the relevant service manual. The new

Bellows valise
Currently the bellows is wrapped with pillowflex/bubblewrap. This pillowflex/
bubblewrap must be removed and replaced at each service to allow inspection. 
This is a time-consuming process.
A new bellows valise has been introduced which will protect the item but which 
can be easily opened and, if serviceable, re-used at each liferaft service.
Pillowflex/bubblewrap must not be used. The new bellows valise must be used.

D.	
Canopy zips
The current canopy zip pullers are made of a metal which might become 
corroded. A new resin zip puller has been introduced which is not susceptible to 
corrosion.
If you need to replace a metal zip puller, replace each zip puller on the liferaft 
with a resin zip puller. Do not mix metal and resin zip pullers.

Marine — Liferaft Container :
Introduction of multi-label sheets
Version 2:
Mar/23

1.	
Introduction
The current labelling process of marine liferaft containers uses a series of labels 
which are purchased and controlled separately. This is a time consuming process, 
made more complicated by the multiple container/liferaft configurations that are 
catered for. Additionally, ‘do-not-cut’ tape is wrapped around each container strap and 
is replaced every time a liferaft is serviced, generating significant single-use plastic 
waste.
Survitec has introduced multi-label sheets whereby all labels required for a given 
liferaft container are included on one sheet. The multi-label sheets also feature 
‘do-not-cut’ labels which replace the ‘do-not-cut’ tape that is currently used.
This service bulletin tells you how to remove existing container labels from the 
container and replace with the new container labels from the respective multi-label 
sheet.
There will be an introductory period during which individual labels may be purchased 
to balance stock levels, but once complete, new multi-label sheets must be 
implemented. 
As there are current and legacy products not yet covered by a multi-label sheet, part 
numbers for existing labels will not be made obsolete at this time to enable purchase 
for use on those products only.

and letter relates to individual label.

annual service davit-launch liferafts.
